message: Starting log bloat analysis. First step: locating and sizing agent log files in .agent-workspace
Found bloat! Largest log (129KB) has 3 lines at ~40KB each (39550, 38447, 38193 bytes). Analyzing which line numbers and what content causes this.
Quantified bloat: 3/16 lines are >10KB (19% of lines). Total 132KB log, 76% savings possible with 5KB truncation. All bloat is tool_result content (93% of line size). Now identifying which MCP tool.
Analyzed 3 log files. Bloat pattern confirmed: MCP update_agent_progress tool_result containing coordination_info. Creating comprehensive analysis document with quantified data.

ANALYSIS COMPLETE. Document: output_bloat_analysis.md. ROOT CAUSE: MCP update_agent_progress returns 35KB coordination_info (full agent prompts + task state) in EVERY tool_result. EVIDENCE: Analyzed 3 real logs, 60% of tool_results bloated. QUANTIFIED: 76% space savings possible with 5KB truncation. SOLUTION: Smart truncation of coordination_info field preserves essential data while removing bloat. Full analysis with line numbers, examples, detection code, and recommendations documented.
